SystemAndRoleList-Documentation.FullQualifiedDomainName: REQUIRED: FQDN of system. Example: cm01.contoso.local
SystemAndRoleList-Documentation.IPAddress:: REQUIRED: One or more IP addresses of the FullQualifiedDomainName separated via comma. The script will run a DNS lookup in case this field was left blank
SystemAndRoleList-Documentation.Description: OPTIONAL: A description for the server to make it easier to identify any system in this config file
SystemAndRoleList-Documentation.SiteCode: SiteCode of the system. Used to match roles to the correct site. To prevent a DP of Site A to connect to Site B for example
SystemAndRoleList-Documentation.ParentSiteCode: SiteCode of the parent site system. Could be a CAS in case of a Primary Site or a Primary Site on case of a Secondary Site
RoleList: REQUIRED: List of roles. A role defines what firewallrules will be applied to a system.
A role could be 'Webserver' for example to be able to define port 80 or 443 in a firewall rule
Define your own rules if necessary and use them in a 'RuleDefinition' (Explained further down)
MECMConsole = Systems running the ConfigMgr console
SiteServer = Site Server wether CAS, PRI or SEC site
SMSProvider = System with SMS Provider role installed
ManagementPoint = System with Management Point role installed
DistributionPoint = System with Distribution Point role installed
EndpointProtectionPoint = System with Endpoint Protection Point role installed
PrimarySoftwareUpdatePoint = The first Software Update Point all other SUPs use
SoftwareUpdatePoint = System with Software Update Point role installed
ReportingServicePoint = System with Reporting Service Point role installed
PRISQLServerRole = SQL Server of Primary Site
SUPSQLServerRole = SQL Server of Software Update Point
CMGConnectionPoint = System with CMG Connection Point role installed
ServiceConnectionPoint = System with Service Connection Point role installed
FallbackStatusPoint = System with Fallback Status Point role installed
StateMigrationPoint = System with State Migration Point role installed
DataWarehouseServicePoint = System with Data Warehouse Service Point role installed
CertificateRegistrationPoint = System with Certificate Registration Point role installed
ContentLibraryServer = System where a remote Content Library is stored
ContentSourceServer = System used as the content source server
ExternalSQLConnection = External system to ConfigMgr with the need to connect to SQL server
RDPSystem = System with the need to connect via RDP to ConfigMgr systems
SMBSystem = System with the need to connect via SMB to ConfigMgr systems

RuleDefinition-Documentation.Source: Source role name from the RoleList of systems. Could be MECMConsole or PrimarySite for example
RuleDefinition-Documentation.Destination: Destination role name from the RoleList of systems. Could be MECMConsole or PrimarySite for example
RuleDefinition-Documentation.Direction: Rule direction. Either Inbound or Outbound
RuleDefinition-Documentation.Profile: Either Domain, Private, Public or Any
RuleDefinition-Documentation.Group: Name if the firewall rule group to be able to group rules together
RuleDefinition-Documentation.IgnoreSiteCode: If set to True the rule will not stick to the sitecode. Can be used to allow a rule for all Distribution Points instead of just the ones of a specific site for example
Services: List fo services from the ServiceDefinition of this file. Example:

ServiceDefinition-Documentation.Name: Name of a service. Used in the services list of a firewall rule.
ServiceDefinition-Documentation.Port: Port or system defined name like RPC, RPCUDP or RPCDynamic
ServiceDefinition-Documentation.Program: Path to a program the rule applies to. Double backslash in path required. Example: %systemroot%\system32\svchost.exe
ServiceDefinition-Documentation.Description: Description of the service. Not used in the rule, for for the config file

SystemAndRoleList.Description: Main Primary Site without MP and DP
